page.title: 07RELIGION-SWINFORD'S CHURCHES
page.content: {The Parish Church of All Saints} stands in the centre of the village. The Church in some form has stood on this site since Norman Times. The stone built Church consists of nave, chancel, north and south aisles with a square embattled tower containing four bells. The bells can only be chimed because the tower is now unsafe. The font is Norman and there are some fine examples of stained glass. This year the Vicar moved into a newly built{Vicarage}next door to the old Vicarage which has been converted into an old people's home. There is also another Church, a{ {Congregational Chapel}which was founded in 1810 and is still active.
